title: kubernetes-client and kubernetes extension combinations don't generate the correct things
body:
### Describe the bug

If I have a project which contains both the `kubernetes-client` extension and any of the other kubernetes extensions (`openshift`, `kubernetes`, `minikube`), if `src/main/kubernetes` contains other `Deployments`/etc, then the `ServiceAccount` object doesn't get generated, yet a `serviceAccountName` attribute gets added to each and every `Deployment` or `DeploymentConfig`.

 This should not happen.

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

Here's a reproducer:

[kubernetes-service-account.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/8731934/kubernetes-service-account.zip)

1. Download & unzip `kubernetes-service-account.zip`
2. `cd kubernetes-service-account`
3. `./mvnw clean package -DskipTests -Dquarkus.kubernetes.deployment-type=openshift`
4. Inspect `target/kubernetes/openshift.yml`

Notice there is is only a single `kind: ServiceAccount` object for the `fights-db`, yet the `DeploymentConfig` for `name: kubernetes-service-account` contains `serviceAccountName: kubernetes-service-account`, which does not exist.

This fails to deploy because the service account is missing.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_
